article_title: Christopher White: Surrogacy Gives Birth to an Unusual Alliance
article_text:
New York state, Minnesota and Washington, D.C., all have pending legislation that would legalize the practice of commercial surrogacy—paying someone to have a baby on your behalf. Reproductive technology has made surrogacy possible since the 1980s, but it remained relatively rare until recent years as the technology improved and the legalization of same-sex marriage increased the number of childless couples eager to have children.

The Catholic Church has long opposed surrogacy, whether paid or unpaid. Nowadays, with...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Christopher White writes that ethical concerns about paying for babies bridge the sacred-secular gap.
twitter.title: Surrogacy Gives Birth to an Unusual Alliance

article_summary:
New York state, Minnesota and Washington, D.C., all have pending legislation that would legalize the practice of commercial surrogacy—paying someone to have a baby on your behalf.
The Catholic Church has long opposed surrogacy, whether paid or unpaid.
Reproductive technology has made surrogacy possible since the 1980s, but it remained relatively rare until recent years as the technology improved and the legalization of same-sex marriage increased the number of childless couples eager to have children.
